result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Schwantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 6  months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 25 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Schwantes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Steven A Schwantes
Current: 2112 Jefferson Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 03-04-2016)
Prior: 5707 W Carlsville Rd #122, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Steven A Schwantes in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Steven A Schwantes appeared by phone. Attorney John F. Peterson appeared in Court on behalf of Atty Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's car broke down. Defense advises that Defense needs time to go over offer with Defendant, requests status. Defendant agrees. Bond continues as is. Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Steven A Schwantes in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has not been able to pick up discovery yet, requests January date.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
No contact direct or indirect with BS. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Steven A Schwantes in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Bond set. Defense enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
